articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Acquaints Himself with Fertilizer Production
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Acquaints Himself with Fertilizer Production
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim acquainted himself with the production of fertilizers at the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex on the spot.
					 He went round humic acid and moulding shops and other fertilizer production processes of the complex before having a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting underscored the important duty of the complex to bring about leaping progress on the agricultural front, the lifeline for improving the standard of people's of living, and took measures for boosting the fertilizer production including those for updating the gasification project on the basis of ultra-modern science and technology and ensuring a timely and sufficient supply of raw materials and power by the related units.
					
					 Earlier, he learned in detail about the role of the Inspection Committee for Checking Equipment at the Pyongyang Textile Mill and the maintenance of equipment through the operation of the day of its inspection and the week and month for checking lathe No. 26 model machines on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the model machine movement started by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Vice-President of China Hopes for Better Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Vice-President of China Hopes for Better Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- We wish the Korean people greater success in building a great prosperous and powerful country under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Xi Jinping, standing member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-president of the People's Republic of China, said this on Thursday when Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to his country, paid a courtesy call on him.
					
					He noted that Kim Jong Il visited China twice last year to meet with President Hu Jintao and reach an agreement of views on the bilateral relations and major issues of common concern. This year the leader received Meng Jianzhu, state councilor of China, on a visit to the DPRK and enjoyed together with officials of the Chinese embassy in Pyongyang a concert given by the Unhasu Orchestra on the 15th of January under the lunar calendar, he added.
					
					 It is the fixed strategic policy of the Chinese party and government to steadily develop the China-DPRK relations of neighborly friendship and cooperation, Xi said.
					
					 He hoped that the bilateral relations would further develop by maintaining exchange of high-level visits, deepening understanding of each other's strategic view and strengthening economic cooperation.

articles.title: Member of European Parliament Arrives
articles.content:
Member of European Parliament Arrives
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Frank Engel, member of the European Parliament from Christian Social People’s Party of Luxembourg, arrived here Friday.

articles.title: Top Prizes of IHE Awarded to Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia
articles.content:
Top Prizes of IHE Awarded to Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia were awarded gold prize and gold prize for exhibition, top prizes of the international orchid flowers contest of the 2011 International Horticultural Exposition in Xi'an, China.
					 The contest brought together the DPRK, Thailand, Japan, Sweden, Switzerland and other countries and regions and many units of China.
					
					 An awarding ceremony was held in Xi'an on Wednesday.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the preparatory committee for the 2011 International Horticultural Exposition in Xi'an, China declared a decision to award gold prize, top prize of the contest, to Kimilsungia and the specially instituted gold prize for exhibition to Kimjongilia at the ceremony.
					
					 The diplomas and cups awarded to Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia were handed to the vice-chairman of the Korea Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee.

articles.title: Generating Equipment Ready for Paektusan Power Station
articles.content:
Generating Equipment Ready for Paektusan Power Station 
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Recently, the Taean Heavy Machine Complex of the DPRK completed the assembling of the last generator for Paektusan Songun Youth Power Station No. 1.
					 The complex finished the job, while working on the production of  generating equipment for the Huichon Power Station now under construction.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Taean Electric Alliances Factory already manufactured the main transformer and current transformer needed for the Paektusan power station.

articles.title: Special Zone for Int'l Tourism to Be Established
articles.content:
Special Zone for Int'l Tourism to Be Established
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KNA) -- A special zone for international tour of Mt. Kumgang will be established in the DPRK.
					 A decree on this decision was issued by the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly on Friday.
					
					 According to the decree, the special zone is to be set in the area of Mt. Kumgang in Kangwon Province and the zone will include the township and some areas of Onjong-ri in Kosong County, Lagoon Samil, Sea Kumgang area, Inner Kumgang area of Kumgang County and some areas of Thongchon County.
					
					 The DPRK sovereignty will be exercised over the zone. 
					
					 The DPRK will encourage free investment in the development of the special zone by corporate bodies, individuals and other economic bodies and protect by law the invested capital and properties and income and other profits to be gained through business.
					
					 The Central Tourist Guidance Agency shall take relevant measures to increase new tourist destinations, depending on the progress made in the SZ development.
					
					 The decree of the SPA Presidium on "Setting Up Mt. Kumgang Tourist Zone in the DPRK" issued on Oct. 23, 2002 is no longer valid.

articles.title: Sports Contest for Mangyongdae Prize Closes
articles.content:
Sports Contest for Mangyongdae Prize Closes
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- A sports contest for Mangyongdae prize took place in Pyongyang, Nampho, Wonsan, Chongjin and other places of the DPRK from March 10 on the occasion of the Day of the Sun, the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 New national records were set in various events including weightlifting, shooting and field and track.
					
					 Men and women players of the April 25 Sports Group emerged winners in basketball, men players of the April 25 Sports Group and women players of the Pyongyang Sports Group in volleyball, men players of the Kigwancha Sports Group in baseball, women players of the Moranbong Sports Group of Pyongyang in softball, men players of the Taesongsan Sports Group and women players of the Jangsan Sports Group in the short-track speed skating event.
					
					 A closing ceremony was held at the Basketball Gymnasium in Chongchun Street on Friday.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kang Nung Su, vice-premier of the Cabinet, and others.
					
					 Pak Myong Chol, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, made a closing address.

articles.title: Spring Tree Planting Brisk
articles.content:
Spring Tree Planting Brisk 
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Spring tree planting is brisk in different parts of the DPRK.
					 The plan for Spring tree planting was carried out in many cities and counties.
					
					 South Hwanghae Province carried out its tree planting plan at 104 percent.
					
					 Not only forest management stations in cities and counties but institutions, industrial establishments and farms tended well fields under saplings and planted them in the right soil.
					
					 Various counties planted Changsong larch, acacia, Pyongyang poplar and other trees, turning mountains into thick woodland and adding to the scenic beauty of streets and villages.
					
					 Nampho City honored its plan for spring tree planting ahead of schedule.
					
					 The city worked out a detailed plan for different areas and fields on the principle of right tree to the right soil and energetically pushed ahead with the tree planting.
					
					 Officials and other working people and school youth and children in the city planted tens of millions of trees.
					
					 Spring tree planting quotas have been carried out at more than 95 percent in Pyongyang and North Hwanghae Province.
					
					 Ever greater successes in the tree planting are reported from cities and counties of South Hamgyong, North Phyongan and Kangwon provinces.

articles.title: New Postage Stamps Published
articles.content:
New Postage Stamps Published
						
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK has issued a sheetlet and an individual stamp to commemorate the 2011 International Horticultural Exposition in Xi'an, China.
					 Seen in the stamps are letters "Commemoration of the 2011 International Horticultural Exposition in Xi'an" written in Korean, Chinese and English.
					
					 The sheetlet contains pictures of Kimilsungia, Kimjongilia, peony and other beautiful flowers, as well as the emblem of the exposition.
					
					 The individual stamp carries a picture of magnolia, the national flower of Korea.

articles.title: Consumer Goods Show Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Consumer Goods Show Held in Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- A consumer goods exhibition took place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition in Pyongyang some time ago.
					Districts and counties in Pyongyang City presented over 10,000 pieces to the August 3 Mass Consumer Goods Show.
					
					The show-pieces were considered much better in quality than those presented last year.
					
					 The exhibits of Taedonggang, Central, Tongdaewon and Rangnang districts and Kangnam County included various kinds of textile goods, women's bags and grasswork.
					
					 Those of Songyo and Pothonggang districts were made with by-products from garment and daily necessities factories.
					
					 Samsok and Sunan districts enjoyed a favorable comment as they presented what were made with raw materials abundant in their areas.

articles.title: Promising Woman Weightlifter
articles.content:
Promising Woman Weightlifter
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Jong Chun Mi is a weightlifting ace belonging to the Pyongyang Sports Team.
					 Jong, 26, made a good job at the 2011 Asian Weightlifting Championship held some time ago.
					
					 She bagged a gold medal in jerking and silver medals in snatch and total in the 58 kg category.
					
					 She joined the Pyongyang Sports Team at the age of 16. She emerged a top-notcher in the domestic youth event after two years and national champion after another two years.
					
					 The 21st Asian Women's Weightlifting Championship was the first international tournament she attended. She proved successful at the championship and took the first place at the 5th East Asian Games.

articles.title: Korean Children Enjoy Great Benefits from Law
articles.content:
Korean Children Enjoy Great Benefits from Law
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- On April 29, Juche 65 (1976), the Law on the Nursing and Upbringing of Children was adopted in the DPRK at the Sixth Session of the Fifth Supreme People Assembly.
					 Ri Yong Hui, head of Pyongyang September 15 Weekly Nursery, told KCNA that thanks to the law the children are nursed and brought up at the state expense.
					
					 The DPRK government spares no investment in nurturing children, regarding it as a principle of its activities to preferentially provide them with best things, she said, adding:
					
					 Even in the period of the Arduous March, Forced March, when the country was in hard time, the government never failed to provide children with food, bean milk and fruits on a regular basis.
					
					 It gives priority to the production of amusement and teaching tools necessary for children's intellectual development.
					
					 Medical check-up and inoculation systems are working well in the country to promote their health.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts US for Talking about "Nuclear and Missile Threat" from DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts US for Talking about "Nuclear and Missile Threat" from DPRK
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The U.S. keeps talking about "nuclear and missile threat" and "danger of provocation" from the DPRK and crying out for strong counter-measures.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					  "The ballistic missile and nuclear threat" touted by the United States is nothing but sophism to justify its exercises for a war against the DPRK and scheme to step up its arms buildup. 
					
					 Lurking behind this is a sinister intention of the U.S. bellicose forces to bring the situation of the Korean Peninsula to an extreme phase.
					
					 If brass hats of the U.S. military had wished to convince the participants in U.S. congressional hearings of who is to chiefly blame for this threat, they should have clarified, to begin with, whom the huge forces in south Korea, the Pacific and the U.S. mainland targeted against and what they were after, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. is the arch criminal perpetrating provocations and posing threats to the peninsula. 
					
					 It is entirely just for the DPRK to bolster up its war deterrent to cope with the tense situation prevailing on the peninsula where a war may break out any moment due to the U.S. imperialists. 
					
					 The DPRK's capability for self-defence is not for threatening anyone. Whoever does not intend to provoke the DPRK needs not to worry about it. 
					
					 The U.S. warlike forces would be well advised to properly know who their rival is and drop their reckless war scenario against the DPRK, away from their anachronistic Cold War-minded way of thinking.

articles.title: Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islets Denounced
articles.content:
Japan's Moves to Grab Tok Islets Denounced
						
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Japanese Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology recently approved 12 kinds of textbooks raising a claim to Tok Islets.
					 Leading papers of the DPRK Friday term this as absolutely unpardonable as it is a sheer distortion of history and a move to grab other's territory.
					
					 Japan's claim to Tok Islets is a brazen-faced one aimed to put the territory of other country under its control. This goes to prove that Japan is still keen to repeat the crime-woven past, remaining unchanged in its aggressive nature, Rodong Sinmun says in a bylined article.
					
					 The article goes on:
					
					 Tok Islets are part of the inviolable territory of Korea. The Japanese reactionaries are seeking to grab Tok Islets, insisting that they belong to Japan. This is a wanton infringement upon the sovereignty of the DPRK.
					
					 The reactionaries of Japan let history book writers include the claim to Tok Islets in the books, prompted by a sinister purpose, in a bid to teach the young Japanese distorted history and use them as a shock brigade and cannon fodder for realizing their ambition for reinvasion.
					
					 This behavior is a serious problem which should be viewed in linkage with their evermore undisguised moves to turn their country into a military giant and launch overseas expansion. 
					
					 They should bear in mind that Tok Islets always remain part of the inviolable territory of Korea.
					
					 Minju Joson in a bylined article says that the moves shamelessly stepped up by Japan to grab other's territory and tamper with its history, paying no heed to the reasonable demands of the Korean people and the international community, are as foolish as precipitating its own self-destruction.

articles.title: Linking Resumption of Six-party Talks with "Cheonan" Case Opposed
articles.content:
Linking Resumption of Six-party Talks with "Cheonan" Case Opposed 
						
Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The south Korean "government" should not link the resumption of the six-party talks with the "Cheonan" warship and Yonphyong Island shelling cases, urged south Korean MBC.
					 The south side's assertion that the south-north dialogue should not be passing courtesy just to resume the six-party talks leaves the room to interpret the dialogue is meaningless unless "the north takes a sincere step" for the settlement of the above-said cases, it noted.

articles.title: Correct Understanding of Tyrannical Action Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Correct Understanding of Tyrannical Action Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Nationalist Forum for 21st Century, the Society of the  April Revolution and other organizations of south Korea, at a seminar in Seoul on April 26, called for having a correct understanding of the "May 16 military coup."
					 At the seminar speakers branded the coup in south Korea 50 years ago as a tyrannical action against democracy.
					
					 They declared that Park Chung-Hee and coup forces brought to naught the success of the April 19 uprising and grabbed power by rallying forces opposed to the nation.
					
					 They charged that the coup forces rendered the society fascist after making the attack on the democratic forces as their primary target.
					
					 The coup was carried out according to the U.S. strategy, they held.
					
					 They stressed the need for various circles to have a correct understanding of the coup.

articles.title: Provocative Naval Maneuvers to Be Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Provocative Naval Maneuvers to Be Staged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The 3rd Fleet of the south Korean puppet navy is mulling staging a naval maneuver in the waters off Chuja Island of Jeju, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 Involved in the maneuver aimed to cope with someone's "intrusion and provocation" will be patrol craft, a group of high-speed boats, maritime police and other war hardware and forces, the news agency said.
					
					 The 33rd flotilla of the puppet navy in Pusan is planning to stage a naval maneuver targeted against the DPRK in the waters off Yokji Island.
					
					 The ceaseless war maneuvers of the puppet warmongers in the waters off the Korean Peninsula are an undisguised challenge to all the fellow countrymen aspiring after national reconciliation, unity and peace.

articles.title: Anniversary of Magazine Thongil Phyongron Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Magazine Thongil Phyongron Observed
 Tokyo, April 27 (KNS-KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Tokyo on April 23 to mark the 50th anniversary of Thongil Phyongron, a magazine published in Japan.
					 Present there were those concerned of the movement for national reunification, officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), compatriots and Japanese figures.
					
					 Choe Sok Ryong, manager and concurrently chief editor of the magazine, spoke at the meeting.
					
					 Over the past five decades since the foundation of the magazine in April 1961, it has dynamically traversed the road of national reunification, he noted, adding that it will energetically wield the pen of reunification in the future, too.
					
					 An Pyong Ok, vice-chairperson of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, Shoji Yamada, honorary professor at Rikkyo University, Yun Pyok Am, resident priest of the Kukphyong Temple, and Ro Kil Nam, editor of the Minjok Thongsin, expressed hope that the magazine would contribute to achieving the unity of overseas Koreans desire of national reunification on the basis of the spirit of "By our nation itself" laid down in the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet by Peruvian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Posted on Internet by Peruvian Organization
						
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Peruvian-Korean Institute of Culture and Friendship on April 21 posted on its Internet website the full text of President Kim Il Sung's work "10-Point Programme of the Great Unity of the Whole Nation for the Reunification of the Country".
					 The work, published on April 6, Juche 82 (1993), comprehensively clarifies the issues of founding a unified state through the unity of the whole nation, achieving unity on the basis of patriotism and spirit of national independence, promoting co-existence, co-prosperity and common interests and ending all political disputes that foster division and confrontation between fellow countrymen and attaining trust and unity between the north and the south.
					
					 It also indicates overall ways for achieving the great national unity including the matters of not rejecting each other because of differing ism but advancing hand in hand on the road of national reunification.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Lauded Abroad 
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of different countries carried special write-ups with photographs on President Kim Il Sung's revolutionary activities on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					 The April 13th issue of the Lao newspaper Pasason in an article titled "Great Leader of People" said that Kim Il Sung founded the Juche idea and indicated the Juche-oriented line of the Korean revolution on the basis of it and led the 15 years-long anti-Japanese armed struggle to victory without a state backing and the support from a regular army, relying on the inexhaustible strength of the popular masses.
					
					 The newspaper related stories that Kim Il Sung made ceaseless journeys for the people's happiness all his life and many foreign friends were completely attracted by his noble personality as a great man.
					
					 The April 18th issue of the Lao newspaper Vientiane Mai edited a similar article.
					
					 The April 14th issue of La Prosperite, a newspaper of Democratic Congo, in articles under various titles praised Kim Il Sung as the iron-willed commander who defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialisms in one generation and defended the country and nation's sovereignty and dignity. 
					
					 The newspaper said that he not only established the socialist system centered on the popular masses in Korea but provided tireless field guidance to every nook and corner of the country for the people's happy life even at the advanced age of 80.  
					
					 The April 17th issue of Post, a newspaper of Zambia, carried an article titled "Kim Il Sung, Eternal President" dealing with his undying feats performed in the nation-building.

articles.title: KPA's Birthday Celebrated in Brazil
articles.content:
KPA's Birthday Celebrated in Brazil
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- The Brazil-Korea Friendship Association issued a bulletin on April 22 to mark the 79th birthday of the Korean People's Army.
					 The bulletin carried an article titled "KPA Always Emerging Victorious under Banner of Songun", which said:
					
					 The nearly 80 year-long history of the KPA is shining as the history of the strong army which has always emerged victorious under the leadership of the outstanding brilliant commanders of Songun.
					
					 The revolutionary history of President Kim Il Sung is that of the Songun revolutionary leadership in which he founded the army first and led the revolution in reliance upon the powerful military might.
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK defeated the Japanese and U.S. imperialists and have grown to be a powerful mainstay of the revolution. This is the shining fruition of the President's line of attaching importance to the military affairs.
					
					 The history of the President's leadership over the army is being successfully carried forward by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as a basic political mode under socialism and has made ceaseless long journey of Songun.
					
					 His leadership is the basic source that helps the DPRK give fullest play to its national power. 
					
					 The KPA is powerfully demonstrating its might as a powerful main force of revolution as it is fully prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique thanks to the Songun politics.

articles.title: Serious Sinking of Ground in Japan
articles.content:
Serious Sinking of Ground in Japan 
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- It was formally confirmed that the ground is sinking in various parts of Japan, affected by the massive quake on March 11. 
					 NHK on Thursday, quoting the results of measurement and survey made by the Ministry of National Land and Communications, said that ground sinking was observed in various places centering around the Pacific coasts of Tohoku region. 
					
					 According to them, the area below 0 m sea level covered just 3 square km before the occurrence of the quake in some areas including Wakabayashi ward in Sendai City and Natori City of Miyagi Prefecture but it reached 16 square km or five times that after they were rocked by the quake. 
					
					 A vast area below 0 m sea level hardly to be seen before was discovered in Iwanuma City and Watari chon of the above-said prefecture. 
					
					 It was clarified that the area whose level was just the same as that of the surface of sea water during the high tide reached 56 square km at present or 24 square km larger than that before the occurrence of the quake. 
					
					 It was reported that ground sank in areas of Natori and Iwanuma cities nearly 5 km from the coast. 
					
					 Not only roads but buildings are submerged in the sunken areas in the period of flood and dead fishes seen floating at inundated houses. 
					
					 Noting that inundation is occurring almost every day in the area extending 400 km on the northeast coast, sources said that it was miserable to see inhabitants in the afflicted area undergoing such disaster even before the aftermath of the quake is not fully eradicated.
					
					 Meanwhile, Tokyo Shimbun on Thursday released data about amounts of radioactive materials detected in various prefectures of Tohoku and Kanto regions for 16 hours till 9:00 a.m.  
					
					 According to the data, amounts of radiation in Fukushima Prefecture reached 1.7 microsievert per hour and those in Tochigi Prefecture 0.67 microsievert per hour, the highest in the ordinary times.
					
					 In the meantime, the Ministry of Forestry and Fisheries clarified that radioactive substance higher than the legal level was detected in feed for domestic animals in Chiba Prefecture.

articles.title: Russian President Publishes Letter on Chernobyl Disaster
articles.content:
Russian President Publishes Letter on Chernobyl Disaster
						
 Moscow, April 27 (KCNA) -- Russian President Dmitri Medvedev on April 26 published a letter addressed to all the citizens on the lapse of 25 years since the Chernobyl disaster.
					 The tragic accident at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant 25 years ago brought the gravest technological engineering disaster to the world, the letter said.
					
					 The aftermath of the Chernobyl disaster has not yet been eradicated finally, it noted, stressing that Russia considers the accident at the nuclear power plant of Japan as serious and more clearly realizes the urgency and importance of the issue of ensuring security of the nuclear objects.

articles.title: China Takes Measures for Foodstuff Security
articles.content:
China Takes Measures for Foodstuff Security 
 Beijing, April 27 (KCNA) -- The General Office of the State Council of China recently issued a notice on severely punishing the illegal use of additives in foodstuff.
					 The notice said that the use of substance harmful to human bodies such as chemical materials which are not additives for foodstuff is banned in the production of foodstuffs.
					
					 It also stressed the need to standardize the production and use of additives for foodstuff and for the units concerned to strictly fulfill their obligations.

articles.title: National Singing Gathering of Youth and Children Starts in China
articles.content:
National Singing Gathering of Youth and Children Starts in China
 Beijing, April 27 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of starting the singing gathering "Always Following the Party" of school youth and children across the country was held at the Shanghai grand theatre recently.
					 This gathering will last till July 1 as part of education on the theme of "Let us learn from the party's history, know about its situation and follow it" now under way on the occasion of the 90th birthday of the Communist Party of China.

articles.title: Establishment of Central Asia-Persian Gulf Transport Corridor Decided
articles.content:
Establishment of Central Asia-Persian Gulf Transport Corridor Decided
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Iran, Oman and Qatar concluded an agreement on the establishment of the Central Asia-Persian Gulf Transport Corridor on April 25.
					 The agreement was inked by the foreign ministers in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan. 
					
					 This will help freight leave the Central Asian countries, pass through the territory of Iran and arrive at ports of Oman and Qatar via ports of Iran.

articles.title: More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
articles.content:
More NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- NATO soldiers are being killed in Afghanistan by attack operations of resistance forces in the country.
					 Two NATO soldiers were killed by a bomb attack of resistance forces in southern Afghanistan on April 23.

articles.title: Anti-US Demos in Iraq and Pakistan
articles.content:
Anti-US Demos in Iraq and Pakistan
						
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Demonstrations took place in Baghdad and Mosul of Iraq on April 23 and 24 in protest against extending the U.S. troops presence beyond the year-end deadline.
					 The chairman of the U.S. military's Joint Chiefs of Staff, recently said Iraq's leaders must move quickly if they want U.S. forces to stay beyond year-end. Thousands of Iraqis turned out in demonstrations in protest against his remarks.
					
					 They strongly demanded the U.S. administration totally withdraw its forces from Iraq till the end of this year, burning U.S. flags and chanting anti-American slogans.
					
					 Meanwhile, a protest was staged in Peshawar, Pakistan, on April 23 and 24 to denounce the air raid of the U.S. forces.

articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Indonesia
articles.content:
Earthquake Jolts Indonesia
						
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- A magnitude 6.0 earthquake jolted Sulawesi Island of Indonesia on April 25.
					 Its epicenter was southeast of the island.

articles.title: "Mediator" Inciting Conflict
articles.content:
"Mediator" Inciting Conflict
 Pyongyang, April 29 (KCNA) -- Recently the United States has openly supported Israel's anti-peace moves, revealing its true colors as wrecker of peace.
					 The world community unanimously condemns Israel's building of Jewish settlements and "security walls", but only the U.S. acts contrary to this trend, though styling itself a mediator of peace in the Middle East.
					
					 On February 18 the UNSC conducted a voting on an anti-Israel resolution, which rejects the persistent expansion of Jewish settlements in West Bank and East Kuds. This resolution, submitted by Arab countries, was voted by 14 member nations of the UNSC but vetoed only by the U.S.
					
					 On April 18 Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu expressed "deep thanks" to the U.S. for having financed the "Iron Dome" missile defense system and the mortar defense system aimed to contain Palestine.
					
					 Under the active patronage of the U.S., Israel is getting more hell-bent on Jewish settlements construction while committing brutal atrocities against Palestinians almost every day.
					
					 It is reported to have prepared massive armed attack on Palestine. The prime minister, the defense minister and other high-ranking officials of Israel would bluster that they are ready to go over into action with strong armed forces. Under this situation the "Iron Dome" system and military units in combat readiness are being deployed in the areas adjacent to West Bank.
					
					 The U.S. protection of Israel is an intentional deed of bringing the Mideast peace process to rupture as it is designed to escalate antagonism between Palestine and Israel and tighten its intervention and domination over this region.
					
					 The ultimate purpose of the U.S. is to make Israel invariably serve as an agent for implementing its aggressive strategy in the Middle East, a region rich in natural resources and a point of strategic importance, and secure its strategic interests in this region.
					
					 Nevertheless, the U.S. is styling itself a coordinator and mediator for the Mideast peace. This is a mockery of the world community and shows moral vulgarity of the U.S.

articles.title: Emitidos sellos dedicados a la exposición mundial de Xi'an
articles.content:
Emitidos sellos dedicados a la exposición mundial de Xi'an
						
Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- El Buró Estatal de Sellos de la República Popular Democrática de Corea dio a luz nuevos sellos (un papel enterizo y un sello individual) en homenaje a la Exposición Hortícola Internacional de Xi'an 2011.
					En ellos están escritas en coreano, chino e inglés las palabras siguientes: "En homenaje a la Exposición Hortícola Internacional de Xi'an 2011".
					
					En el papel enterizo aparecen las flores Kimilsungia y Kimjongilia y las otras raras y hermosas y el emblema de la exposición.
					
					En el otro sello está dibujada la magnolia, flor nacional de Corea.

articles.title: Producidos equipos generadores para la central Songun no.1 de Paektusan
articles.content:
Producidos equipos generadores para la central Songun no.1 de Paektusan
						
Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el Complejo de Maquinaria Pesada de Taean de Corea concluyó el montaje de rotor y la elaboración de accesorios importantes del último generador a se instalados en la Central Hidroeléctrica Juventud Songun no.1 de Paektusan.
					El complejo realizó este éxito cumpliendo simultáneamente su tarea primaria de fabricar los equipos generadores de la Central Hidroeléctrica de Huichon.
					
					Tras averiguar los accesorios faltantes en el generador y otros equipos auxiliares, los funcionarios del complejo organizaron minuciosamente la producción y la dirigieron bien exigiendo a los torneros trabajar con mucha responsabilidad en la elaboración y el ensamblaje del generador.
					
					De otro lado, la Fábrica Eléctrica de Taean concluyó la producción del transformador principal y el otro de corriente eléctrica de la referida central de Paektusan.

articles.title: Periódicos vuelven a condenar a Japón por el problema de islote Tok
articles.content:
Periódicos vuelven a condenar a Japón por el problema de islote Tok
Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- En sus artículos individuales difundidos este viernes, los periódicos capitalinos calificaron de imperdonable la aprobación que dio hace poco el Ministerio de Educación, Cultura, Deporte, Ciencia y Tecnología de Japón a 12 manuales que hacen referencia a la insistencia en la "soberanía japonesa sobre el islote Tok".
					Ese acto significa una flagrante distorsión de la historia encaminada a despojar territorios ajenos y demuestra que Japón quiere repetir su expediente criminal conservando su naturaleza agresiva, señala el diario Rodong Sinmun y continúa:
					
					El islote Tok es un sagrado e intocable territorio coreano.
					
					Sin embargo, los reaccionarios japoneses intentan usurpar ese islote insistiendo en que tienen el derecho sobre él, lo cual constituye un atentado brutal contra la soberanía de Corea.
					
					Al anotar su insistencia injusta en los manuales de historia, ellos pretenden inyectar en las nuevas generaciones la historia tergiversada con el fin de usarlas como avanzada y carne de cañón en la eventual reagresión al continente asiático.
					
					Este comportamiento resulta un problema serio que se debe analizar en relación con las cada día más recrudescentes maniobras de Japón para hacerse una potencia militar y expandirse a ultramar.
					
					Ellos deben tener bien presente que el islote Tok fue, es y será siempre una parte inseparable del territorio coreano.
					
					El periódico Minju Joson subraya que la conducta tan cínica de Japón, que desprecia la justa demanda del pueblo coreano y la sociedad internacional, no dará otro resultado que adelantar la autodestrucción de ese país isleño.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun refuta la teoría de "amenaza" proveniente de la RPDC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun refuta la teoría de "amenaza" proveniente de la RPDC
						
Pyongyang, 29 de abril (ATCC) -- Estados Unidos aboga por el "fortalecimiento de las fuerzas que puedan hacer frente" a la supuesta "amenaza de armas nucleares y misiles" de la RPDC y a la "peligrosidad de provocación" de ella.
					EE.UU. pretende justificar con tal sofisma sus ejercicios bélicos contra la RPDC y el aumento de sus gastos militares.
					
					Así señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este viernes y continúa:
					
					Los belicistas norteamericanos hablan tanto de la inexistente "amenaza" de la RPDC partiendo de su siniestro intento de llevar al extremo la situación de la Península Coreana.
					
					En las audiencias del Congreso, los cabecillas del círculo militar norteamericano suelen convencer a los participantes quién es el amenazador. 
					
					Entonces, ellos deberían explicar primero qué están haciendo y contra quién están desplegados sus enormes efectivos presentes en el suelo surcoreano, la región del Pacífico y el mismo territorio norteamericano.
					
					El provocador y amenazador de verdad en la Península Coreana es precisamente EE.UU.
					
					Es mil veces justo que la RPDC fortaleciera el disuasivo de guerra frente a la situación tan tirante impuesta en la Península Coreana por los imperialistas norteamericanos.
					
					Las fuerzas de autodefensa de la RPDC no sirven para amenazar a otros. Por lo tanto, deben estar despreocupados los que no tienen la intención de atacar a la RPDC.
					
					Las fuerzas belicistas norteamericanas deben ver correctamente a su rival y renunciar su intento de desatar la guerra contra la RPDC apartándose del modo de pensar del período de Guerra Fría.
